intro: Cyrtandra triflora var. arguta, commonly known as the Hawaiian silver vine, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its silver-gray foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and stream banks. It has small, opposite leaves that are covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Cyrtandra triflora var. arguta is considered an important component of Hawaii's native flora and is often found in protected, lowland habitats.
